channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Georgia Voters Stand by Marjorie Taylor Greene After She Stood Up to Trump
item.description: Ms. Greene’s resignation blindsided her conservative Georgia district, which had stuck by her through ups and downs, including her split with the pres...

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, John F. Kennedy’s Granddaughter, Reveals Terminal Cancer Diagnosis
item.description: Tatiana Schlossberg, a daughter of Caroline Kennedy, revealed a terminal cancer diagnosis in an essay published on the anniversary of her grandfather’...

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Exit Deals a Blow to Republicans’ Majority in Congress
item.description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene’s sudden resignation underscored the fragility of the G.O.P. majority, and exposed deep discontent on the right ...

item.title: A Swath of Bank Customer Data Was Hacked. The F.B.I. Is Investigating.
item.description: SitusAMC, a technology vendor for real estate lenders, holds sensitive personal information on the clients of hundreds of its banking customers, inclu...

item.title: 3 Children Are Injured in Grizzly Bear Attack in British Columbia
item.description: The children were among 11 people who were hurt when a grizzly attacked a school group in a remote part of British Columbia, the authorities said.

item.title: A Socialist Priest Embraces Venezuela’s Maduro, an Autocratic Leader
item.description: The Rev. Numa Molina, a Jesuit priest, has championed the poor for decades. Now, he is a power broker and a confidant of Venezuela’s embattled preside...

item.title: Stopping the Greatest Threat to the Amazon, One Fire at a Time
item.description: After four decades of research, a scientist returns to the Amazon in an effort to change the behavior that has led to years of environmental crisis.

item.title: For Marjorie Taylor Greene, a Rough Education in MAGA Politics
item.description: The Georgia congresswoman strove to be both the ultimate Trump warrior and to be taken seriously. She wound up in political exile.

item.title: Coast Guard revises policy on ‘a noose, a swastika, and any symbols or flags co-opted or adopted by hate-based groups’
item.description: Hours after the revelation that it would describe them as "potentially divisive," the Coast Guard made clear, these are "prohibited."

item.title: Republican and Democratic senators alike oppose Trump’s Ukraine peace plan that acquiesces to many Russian demands
item.description: The plan was crafted by the Trump administration and the Kremlin without Ukraine’s involvement.

item.title: More than half of U.S. homes have dropped in value over the last year — and nearly all houses in these cities have seen losses
item.description: "Home values surged over the past six years, and the vast majority of homeowners still have significant equity. What we're seeing now is a normalizati...

item.title: Trump enlists Jack Nicklaus to help revamp the ‘president’s golf course’ — raising questions about who will pay the golf legend and how much
item.description: Nicklaus “will be the architect" and "design it,” Trump told reporters.

item.title: Caesars Palace fined $7.8 million over Shohei Ohtani interpreter’s money laundering issues
item.description: The Nevada Gaming Control Board alleged that Caesars Palace failed to verify bookmaker Mathew Bowyer's source of funds as he gambled between 2017 and ...

item.title: Texas Men Plotted Coup of Haitian Island to Enslave Women and Children, U.S. Says
item.description: The men, who planned to recruit homeless people for the invasion, took Haitian Creole classes and one enrolled in the U.S. Air Force to prepare for an...

item.title: After Russian Strike on Apartment Buildings, Ukraine’s Hope for Survivors Fades
item.description: Russian missiles hit apartment buildings in Ternopil this week, far from the war’s front line. Dozens of civilians, including children, were killed.
